sentence: Frustration began with noticing major cutbacks to amenities to save money
They need to replace the hallway carpets

Room signs that had fallen off the walls were propped up against the wall for my whole stay the carpet was never vacuumed in the hall and was filthy and the housekeeping did not replenish shampoo or soap even though they were empty
The lobby bar and restaurant were still very nice
The person a young college aged male looked stunned as well muttered a few curse words and ran off back down the hall I am assuming to Guest Services
The other issue was the elevators I only took a picture of one of them but they all looked like this picture in dire need of a vacuum and this particular one smelled strongly of vomit
The hotel was filled with groups and one or maybe more of the lifts was out of order
Second floor at end of hall was by vending machine and employee access
In general the rooms and halls felt in need of a renovation

so you are telling me some random person stumbling down the hallway happened to fall into our door because it literally looks shut when you just let it go like an inch away from clicking and locking itself but just not quite
Sheraton property is fine at the lobby level
Huge hotel which can feel a bit dated in the main lobby but overall had nice rooms and is generally well situated
The staff was very responsive and friendly both at the front desk and in the lobby bar
The lobby space was very nice but I wish they would pay some attention to the rooms
Very attentive servers in the largest ballroom in the city
Convention facilities were excellent
Within walking distance of city hall the train station subway and restaurants
The physical facility needs to be brought up to the standards of the marvelous staff
The lobby is large and inviting and hosts a bar that has several craft beers on tap and I restaurant that I did not have time to try
Other floors that I passed on the elevator had excellent lighting
The lobby atrium was very nice
